prompts.text: analog photo with three-quarter view depicting a goth girl necromancer in golden ribcage-armor adorned with occult symbols and skull-shaped pauldrons. Her white hair is styled into twin-buns with long bangs framing her face. She is wearing articulated golden gauntlets and holding a large scythe with intricate details and a serrated blade with attached chains. Her head is tilted and turned to the side looking at the camera with menacingly glowing infernal eyes. Her lips are expressive and painted in black lipstick as she smiles oddly, evoking the impression of an unnatural and ethereal beauty. The background contains blurred crypts, tombstones and eerie red-pink lighting, which serves as a rimlight for the character, backlighting, trees, forest, reflections, chiaroscuro, highly detailed, 4k
oversatured, overexposed, high contrast, ugly, faulty anatomy

—Hello and thanks for downloading this workflow!—


► Built to test the new AuraFlow model, which has amazing prompt adherence and a lot of potential to make use of it.
The 0.2 version of AuraFlow was just released and this workflow showcases multiple 2-Pass approaches to get started, featuring :

   • Aura-SR (super-resolution) upscale
   • Tiled Diffusion
   • Ultimate SD Upscale

• To test everything in this workflow the following custom node packs are required : 

♦ AuraSR-ComfyUI
   — https://github.com/GreenLandisaLie/AuraSR-ComfyUI

♦ ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts
   — https://github.com/pythongosssss/ComfyUI-Custom-Scripts

♦ ComfyUI-Easy-Use
   — https://github.com/yolain/ComfyUI-Easy-Use

♦ ComfyUI-Impact-Pack
   — https://github.com/ltdrdata/ComfyUI-Impact-Pack

♦ ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion
   — https://github.com/shiimizu/ComfyUI-TiledDiffusion

♦ ComfyUi_NNLatentUpscale
   — https://github.com/Ttl/ComfyUi_NNLatentUpscale

♦ ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale
   — https://github.com/ssitu/ComfyUI_UltimateSDUpscale

♦ cg-use-everywhere
   — https://github.com/chrisgoringe/cg-use-everywhere

♦ rgthree-comfy
   — https://github.com/rgthree/rgthree-comfy

♦ was-node-suite-comfyui
   — https://github.com/WASasquatch/was-node-suite-comfyui

♦ AuroFlow model (get the civitai one, if you post generations on there and want the metadata to link):
   — https://civitai.com/models/573326/auraflow
   — https://huggingface.co/fal/AuraFlow-v0.2/tree/main

→ ComfyUI\models\checkpoints


♦ Aura-SR v2 :
Huggingface main page :
   — https://huggingface.co/fal/AuraSR-v2

Direct download links  (rename both files to "Aura-SR-v2" for distinction) :
   — https://huggingface.co/fal/AuraSR-v2/blob/main/model.safetensors
   — https://huggingface.co/fal/AuraSR-v2/blob/main/config.json
→ ComfyUI\models\Aura-SR


♦ "Efficient SDXL VAE" :
   — https://huggingface.co/madebyollin/sdxl-vae-fp16-fix
→ ComfyUI\models\vae

• 'ModelSamplingAuraFlow' is the only node required to run AuraFlow models and is part of ComfyUI's built-in default nodes
   → The <shift> setting is at 1.73 by default and changing that value does alter the image slightly and slowly ruins it when diverging too far. Values I tested ranged from 0.00-8.00 and nothing mind-blowing was to be found there. Stylization sometimes got more cartoony, sometimes a little less so.
I recommend leaving at default.

• SDXL VAEs work for it as well and I used a specific version here that is supposed to be very resource efficient, which is more than welcome

• 'Ultimate SD Upscale' is a safe bet for slow and steady upscales with low denoise values and results in sharp images without much change

→ takes forever though

Working configurations for reference:

— uni_pc normal; steps 25; cfg 3-3.5

— euler normal; steps 25-45; cfg 2.5-4.0

— dpmpp_2m sgm_uniform; steps 30; cfg 3.0

— ddim ddim_uniform; steps 30; cfg 3.0

— deis beta; steps 30; cfg 3.5

► Here are a few findings from my very short time testing this model :

   → colors are very precisely followed
  
   → emphasis weights like (beautiful:1.4) do not work as of yet

   → complex compositions often generate accurately

   → landscapes turn out beautifully detailed and creative

   → stylized settings work easily

   → hands and anatomical details struggle a bit, as well as some other anatomical aspects. Yes, nsfw is a foreign concept.
The showcase gallery also shows a heavy focus on animals, vibrant colors and stylization. 

Gallery link :
https://cloneofsimo.github.io/compare_aura_sd3/


► Keep in mind that this is only version 0.2 of AuraFlow at the time of me building this workflow. So there is a lot more to come and each and every contribution in the form of shared insights, settings, optimizations, ideas, etc. help the model become better and better. 

Supporting the true open source nature of the project and the philosophy behind it, AuraFlow really deserves to reach its potential and, with the community's help, even surpass it.

• This pass is technically not even a pass, but still my recommended choice in place of a 2nd pass.

• AuraFlow does take some time to generate, even in the initial generation, and further passes with upscales like I usually suggest are not recommended as of now, in my opinion.

• The Aura-SR upscaler however works really fast and reliable. Upscaling by 4x and adding sharpness as well as grain to the image like an analog-photography texture.

• 'Tiled Diffusion' is great when guided through a ControlNet that helps keep the image in one piece when using denoise values higher than 0.30.

• Not having that option yet means opting for lower denoise values, which in turn usually results in blurry images. 

• Feel free to share settings leading to satisfying results, if you manage to find any

• The 'Fast Muter' node's *yes/no* switch allows convenient saving of any group's output

• By default all save nodes are set up for lossless webp files with the <filename_prefix> *AuraFlow* 

found in :

"ComfyUI\output\DATE"
• All 2nd Pass options are mutually exclusive and this node is setup to only allow one group to be active at a time
